definition: to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: The spy wormed in the meeting-place.
It means to mix it with inferior substances.
sentences.chinese: 就是把品质低劣的东西混进去。

sentences.english: The thief got into the house by masquerading as a television repairman.
sentences.chinese: 窃贼装成电视修理工混进了房子。

sentences.english: The atmosphere became even more difficult when a group of dissident directors were put into the board mix.
sentences.chinese: 当一个异议者混进了董事会，这种情况变得更加艰难。

sentences.english: A painter tempers his colours by mixing them with oil.
sentences.chinese: 画家把颜料混进油里来调色。

sentences.english: so the demon blends in with the spread-open newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 铺开的报纸里混进了魔鬼。

sentences.english: You can mix the glycerin back in when you make soap.
sentences.chinese: 当你做肥皂的时候你可以再把它们混进去。

sentences.english: Damema assisted him to join a teaching session but still he got kicked out by Marpa.
sentences.chinese: 师母帮他混进别人求法的教学里，还是被赶了出去。

sentences.english: He managed to join the band, though he was not good at it.
sentences.chinese: 尽管他不擅长吹竽，还是设法混进了乐队。

sentences.english: We should not be overcautious or too afraid of reactionaries sneaking in.
sentences.chinese: 不要畏首畏尾，惧怕反动分子混进来。

sentences.english: Don't let any non-members worm in.
He went into the ballroom in disguise.
sentences.chinese: 他乔装打扮了一下就混进了舞厅。

sentences.english: Shi Dong pretends to be convict infiltrate month the jail of 44 heavenly bodies, desire filch helicopter.
sentences.chinese: 史东冒充囚犯混进月四四星球的监狱，欲窃取直升机。

sentences.english: Strong winds pick up the loose dust and dirt, mixing them with industrial pollution.
sentences.chinese: 大风卷起了松散的尘沙，并混进了工业污染物。

sentences.english: If you creep in, please don't let it show.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想在外面偷偷混进来，请不要让人知道。

sentences.english: In weeks, LeiYuan know the location of explosive in the winery.
sentences.chinese: 混进周家，雷远知道了炸药的存放位置，就在酒厂。

definition: to dress up in disguise (idiom); to pretend for the purpose of deceit

pinyin: shen2 bu4 zhi1 gui3 bu4 jue2

definition: to impersonate/to act the part of sb/to disguise oneself as sb else
(of actors) to make up/to disguise oneself
to place in a certain position/to assign to a job/to plant/resettlement (old)
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
to get hold of/to obtain/to secure/to come by
